content.raw:
when I first saw the name of the `pointcloud2` message file, I assumed it was an analog of [sensor_msgs/PointCloud2](https://docs.ros.org/melodic/api/sensor_msgs/html/msg/PointCloud2.html), but it looks like it is a message type that will be deprecated in msgs5? Apologies if this is bike-shedding the name, but I just want to make sure people won't confuse the two.

maybe `pointcloud_color.proto`?
content.html:
when I first saw the name of the pointcloud2 message file, I assumed it was an analog of sensor_msgs/PointCloud2, but it looks like it is a message type that will be deprecated in msgs5? Apologies if this is bike-shedding the name, but I just want to make sure people won't confuse the two.

maybe pointcloud_color.proto?

content.html: ROS sensor_msgs also has EQUIDISTANT

content.raw: 2ae122f
content.html: 2ae122f

content.raw:
I think these parameters apply to the `PLUMP_BOB` model specifically. Other models may have different coefficients, see how the `RATIONAL_POLYNOMIAL` model expects to have 8 parameters [here on line 2053](http://docs.ros.org/jade/api/multisense_ros/html/camera_8cpp_source.html).

Maybe it would be best to have a `repeated double k` here instead, to support multiple models.
content.html:
I think these parameters apply to the PLUMP_BOB model specifically. Other models may have different coefficients, see how the RATIONAL_POLYNOMIAL model expects to have 8 parameters here on line 2053.

Maybe it would be best to have a repeated double k here instead, to support multiple models.

content.raw:
yeah, the ROS message uses an array too, so I think this makes sense.

for reference, I think the equidistant model uses 4 parameters:

* https://github.com/ethz-asl/kalibr/blob/14e47ea0edb7a42efa03533855e533f9e6ad7bb8/aslam_cv/aslam_cameras/src/EquidistantDistortion.cpp
* linked from https://github.com/ros/common_msgs/pull/109

content.raw: I like exposing each parameter explicitly because the message becomes clearer and easier to use. But maybe this can be  a bit limiting. For example, this format doesn't support an [axis skew](http://ksimek.github.io/2013/08/13/intrinsic/#MathJax-Element-12-Frame) element. I'm not sure if there's ever a situation where the 3 elements under the diagonal would be non-zero.
content.html: I like exposing each parameter explicitly because the message becomes clearer and easier to use. But maybe this can be a bit limiting. For example, this format doesn't support an axis skew element. I'm not sure if there's ever a situation where the 3 elements under the diagonal would be non-zero.

content.raw:
the current message matches [sensor_msgs::CameraInfo](http://docs.ros.org/melodic/api/sensor_msgs/html/msg/CameraInfo.html), which also doesn't have axis skew

so it seems like a trade-off between parity with the ROS message and adding more flexibility
content.html:
the current message matches sensor_msgs::CameraInfo, which also doesn't have axis skew

so it seems like a trade-off between parity with the ROS message and adding more flexibility

content.raw: The ROS message uses `float64[9]  K`, so even though it's not documented, users can define skew if they need to.
content.html: The ROS message uses float64[9] K, so even though it's not documented, users can define skew if they need to.

content.raw: The same applies to the `Projection` matrix below.
content.html: The same applies to the Projection matrix below.

4510c8b

content.raw:
## Update

For performance and ease of implementation, we're not going to bridge this message to ROS for now, and instead we'll write a plugin that directly publishes the ROS message. The sensor on `ign-sensors` will publish this message for now, but there will be no consumers (i.e. no way to visualize this message using Ignition or ROS).
content.html:
Update

For performance and ease of implementation, we're not going to bridge this message to ROS for now, and instead we'll write a plugin that directly publishes the ROS message. The sensor on ign-sensors will publish this message for now, but there will be no consumers (i.e. no way to visualize this message using Ignition or ROS).

content.raw: I would prefer to wait to merge this message until we have a plan for using it in case we need to change it
content.html: I would prefer to wait to merge this message until we have a plan for using it in case we need to change it

content.raw:
Another possibility would be not adding this message now, since no one will use it, and only add it once we have a use for it. The RGBD sensor would only publish color and depth images for now, but no Ignition point cloud.

CC @scpeters @iche033
content.html:
Another possibility would be not adding this message now, since no one will use it, and only add it once we have a use for it. The RGBD sensor would only publish color and depth images for now, but no Ignition point cloud.

CC @scpeters @iche033
